statement_html:
Find a function \(\displaystyle f(x)\) whose graph goes through the point \(\displaystyle (0,3)\) and whose slope at any point \(\displaystyle (x,f(x))\) is given by

\(\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \left(\left(1 + \left(1 + 2\frac{x}{n} \right)^3 + \left(1 + 2\frac{2x}{n} \right)^3 + \left(1 + 2\frac{3x}{n} \right)^3 + ... + + \left(1 + 2\frac{(n-1)x}{n} \right)^3 \right)\frac{x}{n} \right)\)
statement_latex:
Find a function $\displaystyle f(x)$ whose graph goes through the point
$\displaystyle (0,3)$ and whose slope at any point
$\displaystyle (x,f(x))$ is given by

$\displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \left(\left(1 + \left(1 + 2\frac{x}{n} \right)^3  + \left(1 + 2\frac{2x}{n} \right)^3  + \left(1 + 2\frac{3x}{n} \right)^3 + ... +  + \left(1 + 2\frac{(n-1)x}{n} \right)^3 \right)\frac{x}{n} \right)$
statement_raw:
Find a function <math> \displaystyle f(x) </math> whose graph goes through the point <math> \displaystyle (0,3) </math> and whose slope at any point  <math> \displaystyle (x,f(x)) </math> is given by

<math> \displaystyle \lim_{n \to \infty} \left(\left(1 + \left(1 + 2\frac{x}{n} \right)^3  + \left(1 + 2\frac{2x}{n} \right)^3  + \left(1 + 2\frac{3x}{n} \right)^3 + ... +  + \left(1 + 2\frac{(n-1)x}{n} \right)^3 \right)\frac{x}{n} \right) </math>
